items.title: Manitoba Government Honours Indigenous Veterans and Supports First-Annual Powwow
How the woman who wasn't allowed to play built a future for Canadian hockey
items.description: Danièle Sauvageau, the girl who grew up in Deux-Montanges, Que., and wasn’t allowed to play on an organized hockey team because she wasn’t a boy, is now the first woman 'Builder' inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame.

items.title: Mystery illness has Manitoba parents seeking genetic answers in Florida
items.description: Only a week after Beau Friesen was born, his parents knew something was wrong, but two years later, they still don't know what. Now, the Grunthal, Man., family is going to Florida to see a genetics expert in search of answers.

items.title: Canadian travellers to Europe face new border measures as security ramps up
items.description: Canadians heading to Europe will soon need new travel clearance as EU officials roll out biometric checks and a €20 ETIAS pass next year.

items.title: A City of Oshawa tree caused sewage to back up in this woman’s home. But the region won’t cover plumbing costs
items.description: An Oshawa woman is warning other homeowners after Durham Region declined to cover $1,600 in plumbing costs caused by a city-owned tree, citing a bylaw.

items.title: How one North Vancouver school is redefining education for neurodiverse learners in B.C.
Moe faces Saskatchewan Party leadership vote
items.description: Premier Scott Moe is to face a leadership vote at his Saskatchewan Party's convention in Saskatoon after capturing the party's fifth-straight majority.
